titleStmt.title: J. Swigert, A. Hancock, and R. E. Collins to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4792

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
-To the Gov: of Kentucky-
-Wash: Freeman a man of colour was convicted at the last term of the Franklin Circuit for selling a small quanitity of Liquor he was ignorant made no defence &c Judt. was rendered agt. him by default for $60 & costs, he is not & never will be able to pay it has been in Jail about 30 days & the state has to support him; he has a wife & children in a starving condition & wife will soon have another child- we pray you to relieve the fine & have him turned out to support his family- a gentleman this ^Dr. Walker says^ he is a fine worker can chop two cords of wood a day - he has been punished sufficiently we think; he will not sin again; the state will be clear of boarding him in Jail & his family will be supported by him & kept off the neighbors - we requests respectfully request you to remit; the Judgment fine & costs.

J. Swigerts
A. Hancock
R E Collins

Franklin Cir Ct
vs
Richard T. Jacob
Lt. & Act. Gov.
Wash Freeman
Tipling
$60 --
16th Apl/64
Remit except fees & costs
